metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10033 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The mailSend function in the isMail transport in PHPMailer before 5.2.18 might allow remote attackers to pass extra parameters to the mail command and consequently execute arbitrary code via a \" (backslash double quote) in a crafted Sender property.

notes.Note: ccdm94> applying the patch to this CVE introduces a new vulnerability, the one related to CVE-2016-10045. Therefore, when patching this CVE, also apply the fix for CVE-2016-10045.

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
